**Fact 3** 
<br /> $i \in [m;n]$
<br /> $m \le n$
<br /> $N_{i}$=?
<br /> n-(m-1)=n-m+1

```{r}
count <- function(m, n){
length((m+1):(n-1))
}
count(-10,90)
```

**Fact 1**
<br /> m=1
<br /> n>0
<br /> $i \in [1;n]$
<br /> $N_{i}$=?
<br /> $N_{i}$=n

```{r}
count <- function(m, n){
length(m:n)
}
count(1,924310)
```

```{r}
evens <- function(x){
  subset(x,             #object to be subsetted
         x %% 2 == 0)   #logical expression indicating elements or rows to keep: missing values are taken as false.
}
evens(8:10)
count <-evens(8:10)
length(count)
```
